Reviews.Author: Big Bad John
Reviews.Content: Big Pic, beautiful color. . .jumps right out to you.  Excellent character definition and does well time after time. Delivered to my door.  Bought some sort of cable, plugged it in right out of the box and it has been running 16 hourd a day ever since.

Reviews.Title: Pretty awesome
Reviews.Author: Casby "-Casby"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, solid color, sharp, clean styling, and very decent sound.Cons-Not a huge fan of the menu system though. More confusing than it needs to be.Really need an auto-detect source feature with all the different inputs it has available that way you're not hitting source four times to switch from TV to Game to XYZ.Doesn't save system settings between sources (i.e. I watch movies with no filtering at 60hz and play games at 120hz. Switching the source doesn't adapt the refresh rate or color profile.)

Reviews.Title: After 6-9 months of online research I picked this model,no regrets
Reviews.Author: R. Dawson
Reviews.Content: It does have everything that make Samsung so popular except it's not a Smart TV but I didn't want a Smart TV,heard it blocks online features but you can use the Samsung USB adapter,or an eithernet plug,or directly from monitor plug,and it's basically a Smart TV,wii-fi or a computer screen.  Only downside is sound but it's a thin screen so small speakers.A sub-woofer will fix that.  I have a Samsung Blue Ray Player BD-E5300,got it for 50.00 on sale and what a picture!!!The remote from TV will work with the Blue Ray once the Allshare downloads.  Still finding more features.I'd buy the same TV if I started looking again.

Reviews.Title: For the price this is the best set available!
Reviews.Author: Camel485
Reviews.Content: This tv has great picture quality... almost, but not quite on par with, some of the previous sets i've had including the Sony nx720 and a samsung plasma d7000. While still a slight notch below those two others, this set competes nicely at a fraction of the other's cost. Its black levels are fairly good and are very consistent. I've been very particular about uniformity across the entire screen and as such have made sure to examine this one very closely, especially in the 4 corners. It has virtually no issues except the slightest of bleed if you get within 6 inches of the screen and look very hard. I keep the backlight setting at about 11 at all times. While this set does lack the bells and whistles of other models, it performs very well for its main function and that is to provide a picture on the screen that looks good. Overall a great tv worth 5 stars and would recommend it to anyone looking in the price range.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: DaveA
Reviews.Content: This is typical Samsung quality. Bright, crisp, clear. Great color saturation. I'm using it as a computer monitor for my media center PC, so I run DVD, mk4, avi and Netflix. All look good. My setup puts me 6' from the screen, so I would definitely notice flaws.The menu is ok, has the standard adjustments. I set the display to what I was satisfied with with no difficulty. Didn't change much from the defaults, mostly just to darken it a little. (Menu response is mushy, as everyone says)A huge flaw in this TV is the PC input does not support 120hz. I bought this TV specifically for 120hz on the PC input for games. It doesn't even show as an option. I will need to switch to HDMI, which I didn't want to do.

Reviews.Title: Love this Samsung LN46D630
Reviews.Author: Apollo P. Tullo
Reviews.Content: I checked out most of the HD tv's at Best Buy, Walmart, and Target for their picture quality and the best one to mewas the Samsung model (in my opionion).  I saw this LN46630 on Amazon for a good price so I decided to purchase it.I am very happy with the picture quality.  I am not tech savvy on electronics but it was easy to set up and all thesettings was pretty simple and you probably have to set the settings to your liking.  I would have given this tv 5stars but gave it 4 stars cause of the speaker system.  I bought an inexpensive speaker bar and now it is complete.Totaly happy and satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Easy on the eyes!
Reviews.Author: Caddoman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this HD TV for my 86 year old mother so that she could watch Golf and Football in more detail.Very easy to set up and program.  Good, sharp picture and sound.  Simple operation.  She did not need a lot of bells and whistles that would only frustrate and confuse her.  She has really enjoyed it.No negatives so far!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase, great product
Reviews.Author: Susanna Fernandez "Susie F"
Reviews.Content: When shopping around for a flat-screen TV I wasn't looking for a Smart TV, 3D, or anything like that. I wanted a TV with a great picture, good sound, fabulous style, and wasn't difficult to set up. This model fully satisfied all those needs. It is a beautiful television, the picture is sharp, clear, with no noticeable lag, the sound is far better than many flat screens, and it was SO easy to set up and modify the settings (display and sound) to the best for my needs. No need to hire a professional to install and calibrate this model, it was a breeze to do it myself!

Reviews.Title: Incredible Value.  Amazing Picture quality with rich color
Reviews.Author: Bergsy
Reviews.Content: I've been using my television for a week now, and this tv is incredible.  The picture quality leaves you speechless with rich color and clarity.  The only reason this tv is less expensive is due to the lack of features.  If you want a quality tv without all the bells and whistles with plenty of connections for HDMI, PC, etc.....then this is the tv for you.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: BW
Reviews.Content: Just received this TV. Love it so far. Had a 7 year old Samsung 36" before, and was not up to the new technology even though the TV itself has been bulletproof and made several moves accross the country and NEVER had a problem with it. I hope this one lives up the same.One week later: LOVE this TV. Great picture. Samsung does it again! Glad I bought it.6-months later: Still love the TV. Absolutely glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture audio not so good
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: I bought this because Samsung has really seem to make great HDTVs as I have always bought only Sony.  Initial setup very easy and the picture is outstanding ,but the audio is poor quality so I am ordering a Soundbar to compensate for this obvious problem. I have adjusted the setting to fix this issue without much luck.

Reviews.Title: Works ALMOST as advertised.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Has the great image quality of Samsung. Came well packed and properly documented. This was bought for hooking up to a computer in an instructional facility. The manual specifies a number of configurations to get computer image and audio to display. One configuration lets you get high definition video and audio from the computer.THAT CONFIGURATION DOES NOT WORK. Tech support came to the site and confirmed there was no problem with the TV. Seems that the documentation of capabilities was NOT CORRECT! Added $150 to the install cost as I had to purchase a specific video card to get the functionality I needed.

Reviews.Title: Love this set!
Reviews.Author: Francis X. Zerbi
Reviews.Content: This Samsung LCD TV probably would not appeal to the extreme technocats, but if you're looking for a great TV at a great price, that's easy to set up, this is your best choice. Lots of input choices, well thought out layout. Samsung is clearly the new Sony in terms of quality and reliability.

Reviews.Title: best picture quality and sound for the price
Reviews.Author: speedrace
Reviews.Content: For the price ,this tv has amazing picture quality and great sound/output. When you have gadgets like roku and ps3 no need to buy fancy tv with apps which will eventually reduce the picture quality , people who prefer good picture and sound this is the right choice.

Reviews.Title: My first HDTV and...
Reviews.Author: jsaubs
Reviews.Content: so far the experience has been great. I have had this HDTV hooked up to my Comcast service for 3- weeks and I am really happy with this purchase. No bells and whistles, no 3D, no SmartTV, just a great HDTV with excellent picture quality.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: surferbob
Reviews.Content: Finally dispatched my 20 plus year old Sony 20 inch CRT (darn son of a guns still working pretty well) - so my perspective for high quality HD 1080 / 120 hz viewing is a bit skewed. That said, I am quite pleased. I bought when Amazon had temporary price dip to around $625. Arrived unscathed. Pretty easy to set up. TV speaker sound not terrible, but I hooked up to my receiver and speakers sooo sound is great.We have only basic Comcast cable, but even without paying the extra for HD, the pictures on select channels are far superior to what I had experienced - crystal clear and I get far more channels than with old tv.Before buying, I compulsively read the 140 + Amazon reviews, as well as countless reviews elsewhere, and a frequent complaint is durability - we shall see...When setting up, I borrowed from others wisdom (as well as the Samsumg website)to help with calibrating.I also purchased a roku xs, and am enjoying the streaming bounties and viewing pleasures that this combo offers.

Reviews.Title: Great value; great picture
Reviews.Author: bobbyrab
Reviews.Content: The TV was simple to set up but please take the time to calibrate properly to your OWN viewing environment. Suggested settings for this TV that are posted by "experts" can be all wrong for your own personal viewing needs. I have mine hooked up to my home theater and the sound is wonderful. The motion can get a bit flukey but I have mine set to custom with blur at 10 and the "J" (forget the term at the moment) set to 0 and there is generally no problem.Keep in mind that the price of this set (40") went from $650 to $625 in the past few days and that Amazon WILL refund the difference on TVs that go down in price if you take action within 2 weeks. Amazon is a pleasure to deal with!

Reviews.Title: HDTV
Reviews.Author: Adrian S. Ali
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV and the "Clear Motionrate" technology is fantastic!  It brings to life HD shows and SD shows and even video files.  This TV has plenty of connections for the tech junkies and I love the Allshare technology which means all of my DLNA devices can see each other and play video, music, or pictures files across my home network!  The only problem I have so far is the iPhone app for the tv, so I can control the tv with my smart phone doesn't recognize the TV.  I also have the same size TV but the D550 model and the Iphone app works just fine with that TV.

Reviews.Title: everything I expected and more.
Reviews.Author: gerhard
Reviews.Content: TV out of the box took 5 minutes to set up and has stunning pictures. I am using on Air Antenna and the tuner even brought in some channels I could not get clearly before. Extremely satisfied with Samsung once again. Cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: Nathan Hedgpeth
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung LN40D630 after a lot of research and after buying, and returning a Samsung UN40D5005 LED model.  The biggest difference to me, other than the physical size of the units, are the options.  The LN40D630 is a far nicer model in my opinion.  The screen is... I can't even put into words.  Seriously, I could watch any bluray on this TV, even if I thought it was a stupid movie, I could watch it.  The screen looks so good.  I am currently using it as my computer monitor as well, and it is super nice to have such a big area, especially when writing or viewing pictures.To cut to the chase, BUY THIS TV!!! YOU WON'T REGRET IT FOR A MINUTE!!! This unit just screams CLASS!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV
Reviews.Author: GD
Reviews.Content: THis was my first LCD TV purchase . Been watching in the dark ages until this. What an eye opener. Beautiful picture. The connections aren't all that clear - even with the manual in hand. The manual also indicated that this TV MUST take a $50 Samsung adapter to obtain a wireless network. I bought the adapter only to find out after hours of re reading the manual and on Live Chat Tech suppport with Samsung , that there is no internet connectivity on this model and that you need a blu ray player or some other device to get this. So again  a little deceiving or misleading in the manual unless you're a bit more tech savvy than I . Maybe one of the downsides to buying on line - is that you can't ask questions.But all in all a very crisp clear HD picture. The soap opera "glow" is definitely noticeable and distracting. The Auto Motion Plus off adjustnment takes care of this though. Worth doing after spending the dough on this set and not wanting any distractions. NIce TV and sleek appearance on the swivel pedastel.

Reviews.Title: Quality HDTV
Reviews.Author: Todor Boyadzhiev
Reviews.Content: If you care about the quality of your picture at your home or office - you would definitely need a HDTV. But there are many LCD HDTV's on the market - if you really want a quality picture you have to get this Samsung. It is really making the colors to live and the pricing is amazing. I could not believe that this quality comes on this price.

Reviews.Title: Everything you would expect and more
Reviews.Author: J. Blair
Reviews.Content: After looking at (2) of its closest competitors, I chose the Samsung 40 inch, 1080p, 120Hz because of its superior picture quality.  Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: My First HDTV
Reviews.Author: Fred W. Hayden, Jr. "old student"
Reviews.Content: In case you are in a hurry, I will begin with my conclusion and recommendation. Buy it! The quality of a Samsung over its competitors is well worth the few extra dollars you might spend over the other brands on the market.See, that wasn't so bad, was it. Now for the rest of us who have more time than money. In my shopping for my first HDTV, I found that the only other brand to equal Samsung's quality is Sony; and their prices run higher than Samsung, but I could not discern any difference in picture to my eyes. One more thing while on the subject of brand. Even though this is my first Samsung TV, it is not my first Samsung product. I am familiar with Samsung's quality through its line of computer related products.The features on this TV will keep anyone busy discovering for years. I especially like how with a couple of clicks on my remote I can let the amount of light in my living room dictate the type of picture that is best. This remote can do anything except go into the kitchen and fix me a cup of coffee. You will discover that you and Samsung's remote will be getting very close.Two things (yes, only two) rather disappoint me: the quality of sound coming from those teeny-weeny speakers, and the weight of this TV (my gosh, it gave me a hernia!). I believe that when I can afford it, I will get a couple of $90 Bose (just right for my apartment) and solve the sound deficiency. As far as the weight problem, it is staying right where it is until I move.All in all, I am very pleased with this 40" as it fits my small apartment very well.

Reviews.Title: Happy TV Watcher
Reviews.Author: the_bake
Reviews.Content: Put off buying a high definition flat screen TV until January of 2012.  My mistake the quality of the Samsung picture is great.  Now I am upset for not doing this years ago.  Easy assembly, straight forward instructions and within minutes after it arrived, I was watching shows on it.  Price was excellent.  I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Great picture; some connectivity issues
Reviews.Author: B. McEwan "yellokat"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung TV from Amazon after comparing it with a bunch of others at a local Target. The price was better here and I could have it delivered at no additional cost with my Prime membership. After using it at least once a day for the past 4 months, I feel that I now have enough experience with this television to write a fair review.The TV is easy to set up and the directions are simple to follow. The set slides on to its pedestal stand and after I tightened a couple of supplied screws I was ready to go. The TV remote has decent sized buttons and good labels, so it's easy to see which buttons operate which functions. Samsung makes much of a bronze colored rim on the bottom of the LCD frame, marketing it as "a touch of color." I couldn't care less, one way or the other. I'm fine with the accent color and would also be fine without it. Overall, the picture is excellent, which is what matters to my family and me.We have one complaint with this television: It doesn't interface well with our cable remote, which we have to use to operate the set when it's hooked up to the cable box. I have checked several times to ensure that the remote is properly programmed, which it is, and also played around with the interior settings on both the TV and the cable box. Still, the set does not turn off when the off switch is pressed on the cable remote. You have to hit the 'system off' button to cut power to the cable box, then hit a different 'power off' button on the cable remote in order to turn off the television. It's a hassle.Also, this set does not work with the remote from our new SONY blu-ray player, even though that is also programmed properly. Same thing -- the blu-ray remote will turn on both the player and the TV, as well as tune the television to the correct source for viewing the blu-ray. But when it's time to turn the blu-ray and the TV off for the night, the latter will not disconnect, nor will it return to the primary source channel so it's ready to receive the usual cable signal the next time the unit is turned on. Instead, we have to turn off the blu-ray player, then use the TV's own dedicated remote to tune it to the primary source and also turn the TV off. Again, it's a hassle.Overall, this is a good television for the money and it most definitely delivers a sharper picture and better color than does a similar LG model I purchased for my sister. But the connectivity issues keep me from giving it five stars.

Reviews.Title: Really nice picture
Reviews.Author: MPower
Reviews.Content: This TV has a beautiful picture. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is the menu system. It's somewhat difficult, and does a few goofy things. One example is if you switch inputs, you have to hit enter or the menu stays on the screen. This sound minor, but if you try and use a universal remote that doesn't have the same 'enter' you have to use both remotes.Overall great TV I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Wonderful picture! For the money cannot beat Samsung. Great entry level LCD HDTV. The 120 hrz makes the picture so much more clear than the 60hrz. I'm glad I spend the little extra to get a more crisp picture. All my friends and family rave on it. Great buy and shipping was fantastic. Ordered on a Wednesday morning using Amazon Prime, and received shipment on Friday. Because of the free 2 day shipping, the prime membership is worth the annual dues with a big purchase like this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent service, excellent TV
Reviews.Author: cjn "cjn"
Reviews.Content: I did hours and hours of research, both online and in stores looking at TVs and our eyes inevitably were drawn back to the excellent quality of the picture on this set. If I had not read even one review, the choice still would have been clear. So we bought one at Amazon, and yes they frequently do have the best price particularly when you factor in no tax and shipping. The TV arrived in TWO days (!) and the package was in perfect condition. It took some time to figure out the setup and controls, but I chalk it up to my lack of techie knowledge. But when we finally got it set up, the quality of the pictures was stunning. We are comparing it to our top-of-the-line Sony Wega which, although we still were happy with it, had grown too small. But we were shocked at the difference in the picture. The TV does take some fiddling with to get it exactly like you prefer, but all the choices are there, like you find with the much more expensive TVs. So far we are very pleased with both Amazon and this TV.Update: We exchanged this 40-TV for the same model, 46-inches (sorry, Amazon, but thanks!) It arrived in 8 days. It is quite a large step-up from our old Sony monster. We really appreciate and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV at a Good Price
Reviews.Author: BBUNDT
Reviews.Content: First flat panel TV purchase. No problems and generally a good value, especially considering that comparable 120Hz, 1080p TVs get to $1,000 pretty quickly. A little disappointed that the brain trust at UPS left our brand new TV sitting on our front porch, but that has nothing to do with Amazon or Samsung.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: W. Whittney Matlock
Reviews.Content: The tv is amazing.  It's got so many features that I had to read the manual in order to understand all of it.The pictures is overwhelmingly crisp and clear.  The sound on the built in speakers is better than I expected, though not good enough to replace my stereo speakers.  The preset picture and audio adjustments are incredible.This is the first tv I've ever paid more than $100 for.  I'm so glad I took the chance.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture.  Great Price
Reviews.Author: D Brubaker
Reviews.Content: Our family couldn't be more pleased with both the picture and features this flat screen offers.  The kid's syes got big when this baby was unwrapped.  The price was great too when shopping Amazon over the holidays.MAKE SURE YOU CHECK YOUR FLATSCREENS JUST AS SOON AS THEY ARRIVE.  Ours had shipping damage, but Amazon saved the day with a new panel shipped in just a couple of days.  GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE AMAZON!

Reviews.Title: Just what we wanted ...
Reviews.Author: Richie
Reviews.Content: After much research and relying on the high-claims of other user reviews for Samsung picture quality, this TV delivers exactly as promised.  Great picture quality, good menu system, plenty of input capability with where we've installed it.  We're using it in a bedroom, where it's a bit large for our need, but I didn't want to go any smaller to 37 or 32 inch, so it's doing well.  We've had it in place for 3 weeks now, and no issues whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Samsung FTW!
Reviews.Author: SeeRayMoo
Reviews.Content: I must have spent days scavenging information on which TV to buy. Contemplating Vizio, Sony, Panasonic, Toshiba, etc. I decided to go with the Samsung and to this day I do not regret my purchase. I've had no problems with this TV and the weight is light enough for me to haul it to a friend's house to get a LAN party started (lol). The size and specs are perfect for watching your favorite show on Netflix or pwning some noobs on Call of Duty (granted you use a HDMI cable, if you use an AV cable on this TV I will personally slap you). I forget the exact price, but I got a massive discount on it through Prime and the purchase was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture...
Reviews.Author: Lew Roth
Reviews.Content: I have only had the unit for a month, so only four stars, but set up was easy and there have been no issues. It is a little more expensive than some of the others this size but it was highly rated by an independent company and so far they were telling the truth.  Nice bright and sharp picture and adequate stereo sound.

Reviews.Title: great picture,wish sound was a little better
Reviews.Author: Mary Kling
Reviews.Content: Really nice HD TV. Easy to hook up and hand device easy to use and understand.  I love the picture quality and one can change contrast, lighting etc. very easily. For a 68 year old woman who is not real savvy about electronic things it was a breeze to set up and watch the same day I received it. I even put the stand together myself and could lift the tv alone.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great service....so far
Reviews.Author: jpsocal
Reviews.Content: I ordered this set a couple of weeks before Thanksgiving hoping to have for that holiday. We were having house guests and I wanted to be able to put a TV into our guest room. It used to be my daughter's room but use had just moved out taking furniture and the TV. I thought I'd replace the TV in the living room with the new set and move the 6+ year old DLP set up to the guest room. Well the new set came the day before our guests arrived (not bad for free shipping) and I will say it's a great set. The picture is fantastic. I purposely didn't get either a smart TV or a 3D because I frankly don't like them. This set for what I paid for it with free shipping and no tax as the deal of the century for me. I have been a fan of Samsung TVs this et has done nothing to change my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: kellen
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with this TV. I've had it for ~3 months and it has been flawless. The picture was amazing out of the box..it required no set up.My favorite features include the "pre set" picture modes that adjusts the TV for different light including "movie, standard, dynamic, and natural."I have a studio apartment and find the TV to be the ideal size for my space.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Cheri J.
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews on this TV before deciding to buy it. My brother has the next model down from this one and the picture is gorgeous! The sound is really good. Although there was no tracking number provided, Vanns did a great job packaging the TV. They also provided the best price I could find online. The instructions and documentation provided for the TV was very helpful. To amplify the sound to create a "theater like" experience, I purchased a Visio sound bar which works with my DVR and PS3. The Samsung TV picture looks live...it took some getting used to. My only complaint about this product is I have yet to figure out how to change the Hz from 60 (the default) to 120.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, easy to set up...
Reviews.Author: toly
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV (Samsung 46' LCD)...  It has fantastic colors and requires very little adjustment (color tint) to my preferences.  I am still wrestling with the interface (i.e. ethernet vs wireless) but when all is said and done I think I will find this a very powerful system in terms of new technology.  Also I am very happy with Amazon and Vann's (who handled the order).  The unit arrive early and in perfect shape.I should note that this was the second TV in my order.  After ordering a 40" Samsung I changed my mind and ordered a 46" Samsung (Go with the 46" IMO).  Before even receiving the first unit, Amazon arraigned for the 40" return and provided the return process for free in a very short period of time.  At the end of the day the whole experience was excellent and I highly recommend Amazon, Vann's and Samsung...

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this tv. A lot of customizability, built in wifi, and amazing picture quality. There are bigger tvs with more add ons (like internet and 3d), but you cant beat $640 for a top brand 40" lcd tv. And the sound really isnt bad at all, like some people have said...after a few customizations in the menu screen it sounds good to me. It obviously isnt surround sound quality, but it is more than sufficient out of the box. Would definitely recommend such a value to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck!
Reviews.Author: Chathena
Reviews.Content: The D630 is the top of the line 120Hz LCD that Samsung offers. Since I'm not hanging the TV, I decided to save some money and go with the LCD over LED. The picture is truly amazing. Prior to purchasing, I went to a store to see the quality in real life and the vivid colors easily made this unit stand out from the other competitors. This has all the connections you should ever need for video and audio.Some cool things I've noticed is that with OTA antenna, you get program information and a TV guide. Also the TV seems to pick up more channels with the rabbit ears than my 4 yr old Samsung 65F series. The set also has numerous controls to change the picture/sound quality to your precise calibration. It also has a built in media player so you can play movies/music/pictures via USB. The media player plays just about any format you need.One thing that got me though is how it was shipped. I thought it was going to be delivered with Amazon's "white glove service" but it was sent to my apartment by FedEx. Perhaps it was because I used Prime shipping. The box showed some damage, but the LCD seems fine and hasn't had issues in the 2 weeks that I've used it.

Reviews.Title: As close to reality as possible
Reviews.Author: Edward J. Daly
Reviews.Content: Being Positive;  I'm currently using this also as my new computer monitor as well as TV...and looking at the bohemoth screen while I write this.The Best pairing by far is with my Samsung blu ray.  I watched Knight and Day with Tom cruise and Cameron Diaz on blu ray...It was more life like than when I saw it at the movie theater.The HD quality is really fantastic...all the background details and texture come to life.  One slight negative; it does get very warm...just like a plasma of the same size.  I am editing this review to add a trick to share with other owners; if you want to turn it on without a remote control place your finger just under the red light indicator on the lower right part of the Bezel frame and hold it there for two seconds, the light should flash and the TV turn on.I have owned this wonderful TV for a year and it is a gem.  I also programmed it as a wake up alarm clock in the morning too ( Menu/ plug & Play/ time/ timer 1 )

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 LCD Television
Reviews.Author: DC Spitz "Coach"
Reviews.Content: Completely satisfied with this product--it being our first flat screen television.  Using it with a cable box.  I chose to install the provided stand.  Easy installation.  Clear instructions for wiring and cables (including Best, Better, Good options).  Synched with my Comcast cable box remote control (not automatically, but the Samsung code was in the remote control literature). Intuitive scrolling for use of USB drive to display pictures, including slideshow option.

Reviews.Title: Great pic and price
Reviews.Author: mk
Reviews.Content: Perfect size for my living room 14'x14' and the touch of color (red) is very subtle and looks nice. It is only on the bottom and hardly noticeable. Color and picture look great, no motion blur.

Reviews.Title: this tv is awesome
Reviews.Author: cornelius
Reviews.Content: people on here are dumb. this tv came out in 2011. there is literally no possible way that anybody could have this for 3 years. Another point, all tv's and tv brands that say 120hz, 240hz, 600hz or whatever, are some form of clear motion rate. there are no movies, tv programming, NOTHING that outputs anything over 60hz. TV brands are just manipulating the picture to try and appear smoother/clearer. honestly this technology sucks for everything. Just turn off this technology as soon as you get it and never look at it again. Maybe people should do some research before actually buy anything and educate themselves on technology before writing bad reviews.Regardless, I love this tv. the picture is awesome. Bluray's look amazing and I couldnt be happier with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: LN40D630 Samsung
Reviews.Author: Sarts1
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I really like this TV so far. I'll change the grade (up or down) when I have a bit more history on this set.I also have a four year old Samsung LCD, which has performed flawlessly since my purchase, so I expect good value on this set.So far, the set has all of the features that I wanted and a great picture to boot. This particular set is used in my sports cave and I've hooked up BluRay and a Roku2 to it with no issues to report.(May I note that I did not purchase this through Amazon. Although I am extremely happy with my Amazon experience with the many items I have purhased through this company, I just don't think this is the right vehicle for expensive TVs)One gripe I have is in regards to those many people that place a review on a product that has no relevance to the product they actually purchased. (i.e. - older model of same, or just a reference to the company they purchased from). Really? How is anyone going to glean information that makes any sense, if your not reviewing the right product?Another gripe refers to those people that buy something that may be considered a big ticket item, but then expect miracles from online shopping for the "best" deal and then not spending a few extra dollars on an extended warranty to protect your investment. There aren't many people that can afford a $700+ mistake, so why not protect yourself from that. Please also remember that you should shop at a reputable establishment. Nothing against Amazon here, but how many of you know anything about the business that actually stocks and ships the product to you?

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: J. Cooper
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing this TV I bought a 51" plasma (samsung PN51D530).  What can I say, the extra few inches enticed me.  Took the TV home and the glare was too much (plasma's have a REAL glass front).  So I took the plasma back and bought this TV.  In comparison this TV is absolutely great!  Way better than the plasma, better picture, better colors, brighter, etc.  It even has deeper blacks (this is one area where plasmas are actually supposed to be superior).  I love this TV and the extra few inches that are gone are not that noticeable.

Reviews.Title: OK TV
Reviews.Author: Mr Podman
Reviews.Content: It is a nice TV.  The picture quality out of the box is stunning when it is on a TV channel that is broadcasting a high quality HD signal.So why only 3 stars from me?1) Cost.  TV's like this one cost about twice as much as they should (compared to the last TV you bought).  Based on cost, they're all a 3/5 in my book.2) Setup.  The TV I bought had trouble initially detecting the TV cable signal during "Plug & Play" start up.  The cable signal worked perfectly on my old TV and on a smaller Samsung I own.  It worked eventually.  When I Googled "Samsung Weak Cable Signal" there was no shortage of items available for viewing.3) Sound Quality.  Sound quality is very basic and unimpressive.  As picture quality on all TV's has improved significantly over the years, sound quality hasn't.4) Features.  One feature of this TV is a scanning function of the ambient light in the room.  The problem is, that "feature" blocks the signal from the remote control for my BOSE system.  This means that every time I turn on my TV I have to use one remote for channel changing and a different remote for volume control for about the first 5-10 minutes.  I'm unable to completely disable that function on the TV and so will have to live with it.  Not good.5) WiFi Capability.  For about $50-$60 you can buy a Samsung dongle and plug it in to this TV making it accessible on your home wifi network.  I did so and can tell you it works.  The problem is that there is no benefit in doing so.  Save your money.  If you want to see your kids pictures on the TV you can use a USB drive.  If you want to watch movies from Netflix etc, the Samsung dongle won't do it for you.  I returned the dongle and bought an Apple TV puck.  Very nice.6) Documentation.  When I was trying to get the wifi dongle to work the TV manual explained I needed to download "PC Share Manager" software from the Samsung website.  A trip to their website yielded a completely different software download called "AllShare".  I presume it is a renamed update for the software but am not sure.  I ended up not installing either.7) Software.  There are a few annoying things.  For example, I have my Apple TV plugged into HDMI port 1.  On the menu screen showing sources I wish it could set it up to say "Apple TV" so that members of my family don't have to remember that I happened to plug it in to port 1.Bottom Line:Nice basic modern TV. Stunning picture quality. Lousy sound quality. Has features that may get in the way of working seamlessly with my Bose surround sound system.  Should cost about half of what it does (as should they all).

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Design
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Peer
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Design, ultra sharp picture, reasonable price, but for sound use an external sounds system.I also like the innovative usability options.Perfect picture, perfect Design -> I am very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: LN46D630 - Really...it's a good TV,
Reviews.Author: Kagoshiman
Reviews.Content: Updating - 2/1/12:Need to provide an update in order to remain honest and consistent with my review. I returned the LN46D630 for a 51" plasma, the Samsung PN51D550C1. Did so primarily to get a larger screen, but also I fortunately was able finally able to see the difference between LCD and plasma. I mean I knew the difference but a little viewing of the latest Tron movie sold me on plasma. I realized that I liked the plasma better for its richer, smother colors...creamier is what I call it.I always debated the difference between LCD and Plasma, orginally deciding on the favorable brightness quality and minimal abmient light reflection with LCD. I still think the LN46D630 provides very good picture quality, but I think I just love the creamier warmth of the plasma. Now, there is the one thing I am still not 100% satisfied with on the new plasma, and that is the bright vividness of whites. The LN46d630 produces the bright colors perfectly. The PN51D550C1 does not. I am a bit bothered by this even though the rest of my household is not. I might need to find another plasma model. The search for complete (bdugeted) happiness continues for me.Anyway, if you decide you like vividness over warmth and richness then I still highly recommend the LN46D630. Enjoy!(I'll review the PN51D550C1 shortly.)*****Original Review:DGiving it 4 stars ... Why? Because nothing is perfect and I'm sure I could complain about something if I thought long about it.Why 4 stars? The picture is awesome. Awesome compared to the top $$ plasma or 4 color LED, perfectly calibrated to -nth degree by really, really sharp guys? Probably not. But it is really good. I mean, I looked at every TV in the price range I wanted to spend, back and forth between plasma and LCD, Sony/LG/Sharp/Panasonic, 60hz to 120hz ... looked at 1080p and 720p. Keep coming back to the LN46D30 because of it's crystal clarity and bright, vivid colors. That's what I wanted. That's what I got.My second choice was going to be a Panasonic TC-P50S30. The images on that TV was just a little richer, you could tell. Again, the deciding factor was that I couldn't get the brightness I sometimes want or need from the plasma. But you can "tone down" the brightness of the Samsung and still get a really good picture, really nice colors. Liked the Samsung over the LG because clarity seemed a little better. We mostly watch cable, have a xbox 360 for games and netflix, and also have an 1st gen. Apple TV. We're not invested in super video this-n-that. Good sports. Good movies. And some games for the kids. But, still, we want good clarity and realistic colors. Super important! Got that with this TV.The Samsung wasn't too difficult to set up. After a few minutes of maneuvering through the nicely intuitive menu we could watch some pretty good TV. But, you'll inevitably will tweak the brightness, contracts, color levels, etc. to ensure you're getting the best picture possible out of this thing. Have fun with that. I mean it. Have some fun.The sound isn't going to be full and rich like we all used to get from pricey TVs, but I was expecting that; we've all read that this thin panels don't produce great sound, right? So I hooked up a my Denon stereo to the TV and my sound problem was solved. You should plan to invest in some a sound bar or something when buying a new panel HDTV.Haven't notice the reputed light leakage. No lag or motion blur. Nope, none of that. Honestly, some of these reviews are just too much. "Horrible this". "Awful that". "Can't get my black and black as ..." - fill in the blank. My advise for purchasing a new HDTV is know your budget and the size you're looking for. Trust the big guys to put a decent, quality TV out there, get extended warranty, and then let your eyes and preference decide. Yeah, check out to see if the model you're interested in is some a a clunker somehow. I spent some time just looking between all those that fit the profile and decided based on what I liked, not because some guy got a dented box and the picture didn't live up to his Sony Triniton from way back when. I went to the store a couple times before deciding, just because I wanted to be sure and I like doing that kind of stuff. Drooled for all the stuff I wasn't prepared to pay for. Then I got real with it...I made my choice. Got the LN46D30. Very happy I did.Watch the setup display tricks at the store though; what do they say now, the "big box" places--geez! I think Best Buy (etc.) will set up a model with 120hz a little cleaner than the 60hz. 'Tell you 720p for a 42" plasma is not as good as 1080p. A little extra beans for them when you get the 120hz. Funny...I bought a 120z model, ya know. Silly me. Just had to have it.Anyway. Go ahead. Check out this model. It's a really good TV. You'll get what you paid for. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Nice, but already a repair
Reviews.Author: Ms*Bindy
Reviews.Content: Who wouldn't love a new TV!  It arrived promptly, and all was good until day 4 when the screen started display double.  We called for service and service was delayed because this product was so new that there were no parts in stock.  When he did arrive, we learned it needed an entirely new screen.  Apparently there are little sensors that run along the perimeter of the screen.  With even one of these out of alignment, the screen malfunctions.  This was not a shipping issue, rather it appears to be a manufacturing defect.  Long story short, the TV is fixed and works nice, with a little hiccup along the way.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Verile
Reviews.Content: All but 1 of my pixels are alive, the picture is crisp and beautiful, the blacks are dark and solid. I couldn't ask for much more. I love this TV. My only real complaint was with the auto motion plus and that can be turned off. Minus 1 star for the dead pixel. Remote could use better functionality; pip only works with TV and pre-ch won't work with sources.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture quality for the price
Reviews.Author: twg
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV for 2 months now and the picture quality and sound are awesome for the price. It just works. I really like the TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Kaustav
Reviews.Content: I picked up the TV via the trial membership of Amazon Prime and selected 1 day shipping from Amazon which they shipped UPS from Arizona.  The TV came in around 6PM that day due to it being shipped to my home and the package, TV came in great shape. Set up took approximately 15 minutes and in no time I had my peripherals plugged into the TV.  I noticed that the remote is a bit sluggish to respond, but that could be due to the china batteries that come with all new electronics nowadays.  The picture quality is EXCELLENT. There is nothing in this price range that even comes close.To really complement this TV, I'm picking up a sound bar (we have a small apartment).  The 10amp speakers work, but only just, but I didn't buy the TV for the sound. I bought it because I wanted vivid images and an excellent refresh rate.One thing I noticed after a while was the TV had a stuck blue pixel in the lower right quadrant of the screen.  I am hoping to resolve this with a new item that is shipping to my residence tomorrow. That is the only gripe I had with it which can be attested to just having a faulty unit.  The rest of the picture quality is SUPERB.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Functionality
Reviews.Author: Adam W
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.  I went with a cheaper brand (Visio) before having speaker issues and upgraded to this one - I love it.  The swiveling bottom is great because you never have to worry about picking it up and breaking it, and the sound is very decent for being so thin and with no noticeable speakers on the frame.  It's a bit shiney and can smudge, but it's easy enough to clean.  It's also just big enough for most rooms and the interface for setup is very easy to use and customizable.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40D630 40 Inch 120HZ LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: SMG
Reviews.Content: Another great product from Samsung. Easy to set up, great picture, with great refresh rate. I only wish I would have waited to get the same version in a smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: AFMcCl3llan
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Big size, great picture.  The digital tuner (that only works if you have cable plugged into the TV) picks up a lot of HD channels and the picture is clear and descript.  My only gripe about that is it doesn't pick up channel information like most HDTV antennas do.Also, I bought the Samsung WIS12ABGNX wireless LAN adapter to go with it.  The wireless connection isn't greatly dependable.  It can go out sometimes just maneuvering through your shared file systems, or while streaming a media file.  And the dual band reception of the adapter is horrible in the 5GHz range.  But I don't know if that's a TV problem, or an adapter problem.  I haven't tried hard-wired Ethernet to test.But besides that, I have no complaints about the TV itself.  Samsung is a great company and is quickly taking over the media hardware/home entertainment market.  And with products like these, I can see why.  But I will state, the 120 Clear Motion Rate isn't much if you're not watching high definition video, like a Blu-Ray.  It's not the clear and fluid motion I want in these newer/higher refresh rates.  But other than that, great TV.

Reviews.Title: Has Been A Terrific Television for Our Family
Reviews.Author: Tim Drake "Author and Journalist"
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching and debating which large-screen television to purchase for our family room, and am so glad I went with this 46-inch Samsung. I was debating another brand that was slightly smaller, but this particular size fits our family room very well. I've been extremely pleased with the performance of the TV over time for films, for gaming, for computer and photo images. Connected to our smart Samsung Blu-ray player, the picture has been stellar and also allows access to films and other Internet content.Early on I wasn't pleased with how some films had the "soap opera" look to them, but I was able to manually adjust some of the features and picture to give them a movie look. There have been no issues since then.I can't think of a single complaint that I have about this unit. It's performed as well, if not better, than I expected, and given our family hours of enjoyable entertainment. I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: jeepmanjr
Reviews.Content: Have had it long enough now to say I would absolutely buy another one.  Flawless, great picture and good sound.  I don't have anything bad to say about it.  Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV and customer assistance from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Golfguy101
Reviews.Content: Received this TV in 2 days as Amazon prime promised. TV turned on, but picture was scrambled. Amazon shipped a new TV that arrived within 2 days and made all of the arrangements to pick up the broken one. Obviously we'd prefer the first TV be working, but you have to know that stuff happens. The most important thing was that Amazon handled better than we could have expected.As for the TV itself -- as advertised. At the time we purchased it, it was one generation removed from the newest models. Picture quality is still great and it is living up to its rep as being one of the best TVs for the money. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Ms Stitch "Life is short - travel!"
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV for the price, lightweight with narrow frame, connections are easy to understand, picture is very good but IMO, not as crisp as our other Samsung models, thus only four stars.

Reviews.Title: Good TV. Just irritated by the broken optical audio out.
Reviews.Author: Aditya Pandit "adi"

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for and maybe a little more...
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D. Sullins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV (46") from a local retailer in my area back in Sept.'12 and can't say enough good things about the picture quality.  I use Standard Picture Setting, Dynamic was too white-washed and faces looked terrible.  Standard is the best, IMO.  I found a few stuck pixels and one dead pixel.  Samsung, and most TV Companies, won't replace or do any repair work on stuck/dead pixels unless there are a cluster of 7 or 8 in a localized area of the screen so I didn't worry about it.  Also, since I can't see any of 'em, unless I'm a few inches from the screen, it doesn't take away from the PQ.  I've read through a lot of the reviews here on Amazon complaining about the PQ and I believe the one's complaining got a different panel version.  The correct, or good "Samsung Panel" for this model is SQ01 or SQ02.  Excellent PQ and solid viewing angle but does have minor flashlighting in bottom two corners.  The other panel is, I believe, a 3rd party panel that has better screen uniformity but horrendous viewing angles and bad PQ.  It's a trade-off and I for one would much rather have the best PQ.  Sound is actually not bad on this set.  Plenty of HDMI Ports, stand was easy to install, and it swivels.  As expected from a 1080p TV, Video Games and Blu-Ray Movies look great.  Motion Resolution is really bad.  The Clear Setting on Auto Motion Plus, is the best setting.  Off, Standard, or Smooth induces terrible juddering/stutter.  Most Samsung TVs, even the ES8000, have Motion Resolution problems.  Clear produces the best, seamless, judder-free viewing experience without soap opera effect.  This TV does have some pretty bad banding, probably one of worst I've ever seen.  It's only evident when LIMITED is activated on PS3.  I've only seen it on Cable/Satellite signals about 5% of the time, depending on what channel is on but it's mostly SD Channels.  Black levels are ok but a little grey at times.  Screen is matte but if you have a lot of windows good luck because it doesn't take away from the glare very well.  Overall, if you're looking for a good set for your living room or bedroom it's a great TV.  It sucks it doesn't go up to 50 or 55" though.  My review is based on the SQ01 Panel Version.

I am not sure if that is the channel itself, or the TV adjusting non-1080p video.
