Reviews.Title: this is my second within one year! seriously...
Reviews.Author: A Texan
Reviews.Content: And still loving it...actually, two of the same...try it out for yourself...no need to spend lots of money for new fads like 3-D...just my humble opinion...

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Shelly
Reviews.Content: We love this SAMSUNG TV.  My husband has wanted a SAMSUNG for a while.  So when I say this one, I had to purchase it. We love the quality and sharpness of the picture. AMAZON thank you for bringing a great product for an excellent price.We ARE SOLD FOR LIVE.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier!
Reviews.Author: T. Kauffman
Reviews.Content: Debated between this TV and a slightly more expensive Sony. After reading poor reviews about the sound quality of the Sony, I decided to purchase the Samsung. Boy am I glad I did. The sound is incredible; haven't raised the volume above 20 and it's loud enough to get over my AC return. I was also very surprised to find that the TV has a great on-screen guide that gives you details of every program from every channel for the next 5 or 6 hours. Since I only have an over the air antenna, this was a feature I wanted but wasn't sure would be availalbe on a TV in my price range. Everything on the TV is easy to adjust using the remote and was a breeze to set up. Would definitely recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46D630 TV
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Johnson "Life with an Angel"
Reviews.Content: Super fast delivery! Easy setup, great picture. We had to replace our 6 yr old 50" Hitachi that I have never been satified with. Even though this new 46" is smaller it certainly is superior.

Reviews.Title: Happy at first, now very disappointed
Reviews.Author: SGTexas
Reviews.Content: I went with the Samsung brand because all my friends recommended it and it was supposed to be a quality brand name in televisions. I purchased my set in January and now it has stopped working less than a year later. I will definitely not be purchasing anything by Samsung ever again if this is the level of "quality" I can expect.Update: They came out to fix the tv and I was told they were going to replace the entire panel. They replaced the panel and turned it on... The replacement was defective as well. They are replacing the tv completely now but I'm not expecting much in the way of life expectancy on that one either.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40D630 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: kayak
Reviews.Content: VERY HAPPY WITH THE PICTURE QUALITY OF THE TV.  USING IT IN A BEDROOM AND VOLUME IS GREAT.  HAD READ SOME OTHER POSTS WHERE THE VOLUME WAS LOW BUT DO NOT FIND THAT IN THIS TV.  HAPPY WITH THE PURCHASE.  HOOKED UP PANASONIC BLU=RAY PLAYER AND EVERYTHING LOOKS GREAT INCLUDING STREAMING NETFLIX.  HAVEN'T TRIED OTHER VIERA CAST OPTIONS YET.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Matty
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. I bought this one because my older Samsung TV fell off the wall due to faulty mounting by a handy man that was hired during home renovation :( And I loved that one too which I've owned for 3 years so I was very sad to see it broken. I went out and bought a new Samsung from BB the same day and I fell in love with this TV the moment I undressed her out the box and sat her right on my new TV stand. I turned her on and fell in love all over again with all the cool new futures that was added to the newer generation of Samsung TV's that I've missed out on for years. Part of me felt guilty watching my Blue-Ray on this TV while the older model was lying lifeless on the floor but I was over it quick once the movie started and I was experiencing the crystal clear quality you get with Samsung TV's all over again. Samsung LN40D630, I cherish you :)

Reviews.Title: Samsung Samsung LN40D630 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S. Klenk
Reviews.Content: Bought mine less in late 2011 - less than 2 years and it died.  None of the easily fixed capacitor issues some write about...probably the board.  TV is dead.  Deceased.  Gone.  "Not worth fixing" said the repairman that Samsung referred me to.  Should have read the reliability ratings.  Samsung HDTV's reliability ratings are the worst for a reason.  They die.  Last Samsung I will buy. Last TV I will buy without extended protection plan.  You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: Not necessarily hard-of-hearing friendly
Reviews.Author: Kalia
Reviews.Content: The TV is beautiful. I have really enjoyed the quality of the images and I love all the features that come with the TV and have taken advantage of quite a few of them.The primary quibble I might have is that closed captioning does not seem to be available on HDMI sources. As someone who depends on that, it's disappointing. Luckily I can just turn on closed captioning through the cable program, but with my DVD player, I have to either use subtitles (which are different from closed captions) or switch to the AVI source.These aren't necessarily big deals, since I've found workarounds for not having closed captions, but it is disappointing that they wouldn't be available in the HDMIs.Other than that, I have been really pleased with my new TV.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: J. Thompson
Reviews.Content: First off, just to clear all of the confusion, this tv is NOT 120hz, BUT it performs as well or better in the motion blur department compared to actual 120hz televisions. I got this TV after returning the LG 40LV4400. The LG's black weren't very dark although it was an LED, and it's motion blur function wasn't very effective at all even though it was supposedly 120hz.BLACKS/COLORS:Although this TV does a lot of things well, the color is the best. Everything looks very lifelike with no colors overpowering others. The blacks are as black as you could reasonably expect from an LCD. There is some clouding, or decrease in contrast when viewing from off angles, but nothing outside of what's the norm for an LCD. I am not getting any light bleed from the corners. If you stand or sit to close though, the edges of the screen may be at an increased angle, and you may start to get light bleed. But if you're sitting a reasonable distance from the tv, you shouldn't see that.Protip-Do not set blacks to "dark", darker, or darkest, you'll lose detail. Also, lower the black level (brightness) by only a notch or two, and lower the backlight to get darker blacks.MOTION:Although this TV is technically a 60hz television, it's motion blur feature works as well as 120hz televisions. I don't care what the box says, only how it performs.Pro tip-I use settings of 2 for motion blur and dejudder when playing movies/television, and 8 and 8 for when playing video games. You don't want the soap opera effect when playing movies. And you don't want to have the processing to high when playing video games which supposedly reduces the television's response time.OTHER FEATURES:One of the best things about this tv is it's ability to play video off of a usb connected device. I have my 500gb external hard drive hooked up via usb and I can play my 1080p .mkv files on the TV without the need to connect my computer or use a dvd player that has a usb media player function.Pro tip- hit the tools button rather than the usual "menu" button to adjust video settings when using the usb media player function.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for Your Buck!
Reviews.Author: F. Lizama
Reviews.Content: I was on the market for my first TV. Costco has great product warranties so I went in and bought a E472VL 47" Vizio LCD. On paper it appeared to be a great value and a USA made product. Both were wrong assumptions. Long story short I returned the Vizio (it was defective and customer support is terrible) did some research and found this gem. The television has every feature you need. Sure it's missing the internet features found on the "Smart" models but hook up your laptop, game console, roku, apple TV, or blu-ray player and voila! you have a "Smart" TV. The picture is great and very customizable. At this price point you won't find a better LCD.

Reviews.Title: 5 year review of LCD TVs
Reviews.Author: Hugh
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46D630 Great TVI have been looking for an LCD TV for 5 years that met my standards. I found that all the brands have weakness in some form or fashion,resolution speed to slow, burn in, blur, blacks are gray/blue, side lit, brand name cost, weak sound, bad 3D, internet capability, WiFi, widgets, heat energy given off, corner spot lights, glare, and cheapen components to cut cost. I found you had to pay approx. 4K-5K and I was not willing to do this. I did find an gem of a TV that meets a lot of these qualities but not all. It is not the lastest or greatest but it is a great buy with solid features with fantastic picture and sound. I do have a 5.1 sound system attached but only use it when I watch one of those great sound effect movies. I also got a steal of a deal @ $850. This is a bedroom tv but would be great in the den as well. Checking this out would be worth the time. I also put a 3 year warranty just in case a pixel went out or line of resolution showed up. I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Jer
Reviews.Content: 3rd Samsung tv we bought.  Picture quality and sound are very good.  I would recommend this Samsung highly and  feel it is top notch.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Ted L.
Reviews.Content: Searched far and wide for the right TV to replace our ancient tube dinosaur. Went to several big box stores and viewed this model alongside other makes/models in its class. In every store, this model had the best picture - at as far as my eye could tell. Easy to mount, easy to set-up, and easy to use. I really can't think of any complaints.

Reviews.Title: samsung 46d6000 great replacement for my old tv
Reviews.Author: don in georgia
Reviews.Content: I decided to replace my old 37 inch monster tv with a 46 inch flat screen and I chose the samsung 46d6000 from Amazon. Amazon's deliver service was oustanding and the original price of $748 with 2 day free shipping was even more outstanding. After a weeks time I checked the price and found it 15 dollars cheaper at Amazon. They responded to me asap with a $15 credit sending the price down to $735 total. As for the quality of the tv itself, very good to outstanding is my rating. I hooked it to my old Sony surround sound and the den rocks. I took the time to adjust all the many adjustments to my taste and looks great. My only concern is that the TV says 60mz on the clear motion rate but it is sold to the public as a 120 rate. I wish I knew if I got scammed or if this is a common problem with Samsung tv's.But anyway, gonna keep it now and would recommend to others to buy.

Reviews.Title: JUST WHAT I EXPECTED
Reviews.Author: L. Fontanella
Reviews.Content: I have a 27" Samsung and knew I was getting a quality product when purchased.....met all expectations, even the sound quality is fine, and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: jaguar22
Reviews.Content: Excellent sharp bright picture. Sound is good  better than my privious Sony Bravia LCD which lasted only 2 1/2 years. Recommend to get 5 year extended warrenty as these new tv's fail  much more than the old tube tv's. Has earphone connection that can be left attached permanently and a optical output for a home speaker system. Good price at Amazon and delivered quickly and safely with a 30 day return policy.

Reviews.Title: Great screen, but the software running it sucks
Reviews.Author: S. Shelton
Reviews.Content: Gotta be quick.The bad parts:1) The TV set will spontaneously change to channel 2 for no reason.2) The component video input jacks on the back just don't work.  One input source (AV1) is a dual component/composite jack where you can either plug in the old SD yellow RCA plug or the new set of 3 jacks for HD sources.  The composite/SD/yellow plug works, but using them as HD inputs does not.  Another input source is exclusively component and it just doesn't work at all.What that means is that the source is disabled in the source list menu and cannot be enabled.  You can refresh the list and they won't enable, and you can explicitly attempt to use one of those sources and you'll be told there's no signal.  You can use AV1 with the old yellow SD cable, yank them out and swap to a composite video source and it still won't work.I have attempted to use these two devices on another HD set and they work just fine.  I even used the same cables that I used on the Samsung so this is not user error, device error, or wire error.  The set just doesn't seem to understand that it's being fed a signal when it comes through these composite video jacks.The device is out of warranty and so I am out of luck.  It just took me this long before I really had a need for these inputs because I prefer HDMI, and those work just fine on this set.I've owned 3 technologically advanced Samsung devices in the last two years and all three of them have needed repair and contained shoddy embedded software.  I'm going to try a firmware update on the set to see if that resolves anything, but if this TV is like my Samsung bluray (which is currently on its second trip to NJ for repair) or my Samsung Instinct phone (the most awful device I've ever owned) then I will not hold out any hope that these glitches are fixed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LCD
Reviews.Author: TimH
Reviews.Content: After a month of looking at and reading about LCD TVs, we chose the Samsung LN46D630. The picture quality is fantastic and setup so simple...

Reviews.Title: A Happy Purchaser
Reviews.Author: Patrick J. Hagen
Reviews.Content: My Samsung arrived a few days earlier than forecast via UPS.  It arrived in good shape with all the advertized accessories. Easy to setup and a pleasure to watch.  Clear crisp picture & great sound.  ...of course I'm moving up from an almost 18 year old 26" analog TV to HD so my expectations were high and they have been met.

Reviews.Author: Haggis
Reviews.Content: (we've only owned this product less than one month)So far we are very happy with it.Set up was easy.Remote is easy to understand and use and we like the remote self lightingfeature so you can see the buttons in the dark.The picture is awesome!The speakers and sound is fine for us without a stereo system.We also liked the swivel base feature.(note:) I bought the square trade warranty for this item.  $99.00

Reviews.Title: it's okay
Reviews.Author: Louise obijiski
Reviews.Content: it's okay,  last Samsung had excellent picture but light bulb had to be replaced every year and was expensive. and difficult to change.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money
Reviews.Author: Isral Debruin "idebruin"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were thrilled to get this TV through Amazon, which saved us a few hundred dollars and got it delivered right to our door for no additional cost. I was initially a bit nervous about that idea, but it arrived well-packed and in perfect condition. It has served us well for the past year and a half. The only thing I wish it had was some sort of internet connectivity, though that seems to come standard with more modern sets.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 1 year
Reviews.Author: T. McRae
Reviews.Content: This TV now has many problems. It stopped working all together last week. Great picture quality and everything, but what good is it if the TV doesn't turn on?

Reviews.Title: interesting picture
Reviews.Author: Lars
Reviews.Content: This t.v. picture freaks me out.  I don't know why it's different from the last Samsung HD flat screen I bought, but it seems like you are actually in the picture.  I feel like I'm on the camera crew.  My family loves it, but I just can't get past feeling like it's just a "play" or something.  Otherwise, I love it, the sound is great.  That was the only thing that was negative on the reviews I read before I bought it.  We don't play any games on it, so maybe that's what the complaints were about.

Reviews.Title: X-Mas Gift
Reviews.Author: supapimp
Reviews.Content: had a 52" Sony RPTV that was on it's last legs. got this TV for X-Mas gift from one of my best boys.  what can i say?  it's a effin' samsung!  oh happy day.

Reviews.Title: good picture poor sound quality
Reviews.Author: rangr
Reviews.Content: I received this TV free and I will admit that it is superior to my older LCD TV.  The picture quality is good. I disabled the AMP because it looked too much like bad soap opera.  The sound quality leaves much to be desired!  It sounds like the sound is coming out of a box.  I've read it described as "tinny".  I can't seem to find a good balance but I'm working on it.

Reviews.Title: Eh.
Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: I had the previous 2010 year model of this tv (LN46C630) and absolutely loved it, but it was destroyed in a home burglary so i purchased this model to replace it.  This model has gone down in quality and performance drastically from the 2010 models.First off, I will say the TV is built solid and arrived in good condition, however the box had been torn and punctured in a few places and looked like it was dropped a few times. I can't believe these aren't double boxed when shipping through a huge carrier like UPS or FedEx.After all the picture tweaking I could handle, the tv always looked dull and washed out.  The picture is not vibrant and lifelike (the 2010 model was), it always looks like a scene in a sad movie, no matter how much backlight, brightness, and other settings i adjusted, it just didn't look right.  The sound is decent, but nothing special for an HDTV. Also, there is a terrible audio sync problem between this TV and my PS3.  DVDs and streaming Netflix were always way off between audio and video and i just couldn't handle that on top of the picture issue for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not thrilled with TV
Reviews.Author: Linda C. Vincent "Living the Good Life"
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews I was expecting to like this TV a lot more than I do. There's a waviness along portions of the screen that just makes some programs look weird.  I've played with the picture display sizes and I can't get it to look right.  In movies it looks like the tops of people's heads are floating.  Sports seem to look OK.  All in all for the price, it's not bad but I have to admit to being disappointed in this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Bad Reliability
Reviews.Author: S. Moses
Reviews.Content: I purchased the LN46C630 and got approximately 13.5 months of great service from the set and then it began strobing.  Samsung customer support is virtually nonexistent and they refused to do anything as the warranty period was exceeded by 1.5 months.  I had the inverter replaced and the same problem occurred in less than 2 months.  This problem is very common to the set and to other Samsung sets as well as evidenced by the various forums.  I cannot speak definitively for the D model, but based on the forums, I suspect little has changed. I will replace this set with a different brand.  I strongly urge anyone considering this set to check the various forums regarding reliability (particularly strobing and inverter issues) before buying any Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: Best TV Ever!
Reviews.Author: Volney Hill
Reviews.Content: Seriously. I do not subscribe to an HD service, primarily because the box is so tacky and unreliable...BUT here is the deal: at least in New Orleans, the 5 local channels (PBS, NBC, CBS, ABC, FOX) and a few others all have secondary HD quality channels available on BASIC CABLE! And this television with its high dpi provides these virtually free programs with stellar high definition visuals.  It's amazing.  OH! And don't worry about the white-trash amber line at the bottom (seriously? C'mon Samsung, it's 2012, NASCAR dads are as lame as Facebook), that line is hardly visible.  Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Unreliable tv.
Reviews.Author: MR
Reviews.Content: Decent picture and aesthetics, very poor reliability.  Three years after my purchase, the set began "clicking" (cycling on/off) 10-15 times prior to starting up.  Apparently, this is a common problem.  I brought my tv in to a Samsung certified repair center to have the capacitors replaced free of charge.  However, they say there is a short in the display board that will cost $851 to fix - probably more than the set itself is worth.  In short, a very disappointing purchase.  I'd definitely recommend the extended warranty with this one.

Reviews.Title: Screen Flickring
Reviews.Author: Kumari
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the TV because the screen start flickring on the TV after 13 months of purchase. Now I have to spend money on the repairs. Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: Broken
Reviews.Author: Dyson
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV on June 2nd, 2011. It was a great TV and my first flat screen LCD tv. The TV worked great until it broke on September 3rd, 2012 (a day outside of warranty.) I contacted Samsung and they processed an in home repair request at my own expense through an authorized TV repairman. I spoke to the authorized TV repairman and brought my flat screen into their shop as it was cheaper. They diagnosed the issue as the backlight inverter and told me to trash it, as it was too expensive to replace and I wouldn't be able to find it online. I subsequently found it online and I am waiting for its arrival to see if I've fixed it. If you buy it, make sure you get the extended warranty.UPDATE: So, it wasn't the inverter backlight. It was the power module. It was a $200 repair. Get the extended protection plan.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: ice
Reviews.Content: Have had this tv since a week before xmas and have had no issues with it. I am liking everything about it so far. Friends ask me if I have 3d on, but I don't even have hd on my sat. reciever. It seems like I'm watching in 3d, but no complaints here!!!! Would recommend to anyone and from the dealer Vannes as well as amazon who I ordered through.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Wins
Reviews.Author: typelore
Reviews.Content: Just set the TV up with the help of son and daughter's bf. Great picture. Need to connect to a receiver. Next week.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: GaGal
Reviews.Content: We checked all types of consumer reviews before choosing this set. It fits in the space we had available, and we are happy with the picture and performance.

Reviews.Title: Customer service and support? You've got to be kidding.
Reviews.Author: wrangler
Reviews.Content: After many attempts (nine) to contact Samsung customer service, we decided to post a review on the Samsung website for this TV. Here is the Samsung reply:  "Your review did not meet our posting guidelines. This may be because it contained references to ... customer service issues." Customers can't comment about customer service!?Some aspects of this TV are OK, but if you need help with Closed Caption, or have a question or a problem regarding other features, there is virtually no customer support. They did not respond to email and telephone support is as bad as could be. The owner's manual is a needlessly complicated tangle. Closed Caption is essential for some users.Since many TVs have the same features, customer service and reliable features are the tie-breakers.The price and source (via Amazon) of this Samsung model seem to vary almost every day. Recently it was $100 less at Best Buy than what I paid at Amazon (Vann's.)

Reviews.Title: worst customer support ever
Reviews.Author: cgeo
Reviews.Content: first off the tv itself is decent, not brilliant but pretty good. definitely feels cheap in some places. the biggest problem is its a samsung i have been dealing with the worst  customer service i have ever experienced in my life from samsung. because of the nature of technology it is inevitable you will have to call support eventually i will never waste my time on a samsung product again. been dealing with what should be a simple issue for over three weeks now do not buy anything from samsung. i have had great service from several other companies with similar products samsung is awful do not buy believe me you regret it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung flat panel purchase
Reviews.Author: Karl Ricker
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Samsung LN40D630 and found the product very good but the purchase process extremely cumbersome.  The process problem:  1)  I purchased it for another family member and did not enter the family member's address - it was impossible to change once the order was made for contractual reasons between Amazon and a third party providing the TV (and Fed Ex, the shipper).  2) Once the order was received, and was found damaged, the return for replacement took another 1.5 weeks.  Conclusion:  Make sure all the shipping information is correct and if the product is not provided by an Amazon warehouse, be especially careful.Samsung LN40D630 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV (Black) [2011 MODEL]

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46D630 46-inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: Buzz
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with my purchase. The picture quality is great. We were watching a movie and there was a party seen. Me and my wife felt like were at the party. Also it was very easy to install and set up.

Reviews.Title: Not recommened
Reviews.Author: sunshine
Reviews.Content: Great price for tv as well as prompt delivery service.However the tv simply did not work.There were no lights flickering no clicking soundings of the tv powering. it just did not work.Also there was no paper work shipped with tv.TV came in its original box with shipping label at the side and no invoice.No warranty came with the tv!!!!!.I did my research before buying this product and all the reviews seem to give Samsung a very high rating, However its only when researching the specific powering problem that you realize how many reviews were found.There clearly seems to be a defect with capacitors on all Samsung models.So I'm stuck with a TV that does not work and  a lot more expense to fix.Did I mention I tired contacting Samsung but they could be of no help.There policy states that they offer no warranty for products bought online.

Reviews.Title: Good until it wasn't
Reviews.Author: John Koehn
Reviews.Content: This TV was amazing for the first 18 months until the screen suddenly became fuzzy and distorted. It comes and goes, with increasing frequency. Samsung says it's not in warranty anymore, conveniently. Buying a Sony next - TVs should last longer than 18 months.

Reviews.Title: (professional gamers beware)Amazing quality, lag issues!!!!!
Reviews.Author: mattahew
Reviews.Content: There are noticeable lag issues with this tv. I tested it, it has 50ms input lag. Amazing quality, sound. Perfectly basic. Some issues with audio lag through hdmi. Haven't done full testing. TV IS NOT 120hz. It's just a clear motion gimic that adds frames. Not true 120. Tv like I said is an amazing tv. All these hd tvs have input lag I've stopped carrying about it. Tv has great blacks and a super crisp picture. I love it. If you're looking for a gaming tv just get a moniter. End of story. Goodbye.

Reviews.Title: Worked For only 13 Months
Reviews.Author: M. burton
Reviews.Content: Only 1 month after the warrenty had expired the TV picture began to strob so that it could not be watched. I contacted customer service which was no help, other than to give me a phone number for a TV repair shop 70 miles away from me.  This was my first and last Samsung TV.  I have an LG Plasma and LED, which I would recommend over the Samsung brand.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TVs in General: It Needs to be Said...
Reviews.Author: burbis
Reviews.Content: Samsung TVs have good sharpness and color. But, in my opinion and the opinions of many others I know, they have an annoying quality to the picture that makes everything look like "video."  Like the way an old-time soap opera used to look. Watching a Samsung makes you feel like you're looking at actors on a set, not a show; the film-like quality is completely gone and replaced with a "video" look.  It's hard to explain but look at them in a store and you'll see what I mean.  I  urchased a 60" Sony and a 40" Samsung this past year, both 120Hz refresh rates, both LCD with LED backlighting, and I would recommend the Sony over the Samsung.  I wouldn't buy another Samsung.

Reviews.Title: no realistic colors here
Reviews.Author: doug richardson
Reviews.Content: Got this TV as a replacement for my 3-year-old VIZIO 46" (neither one of them purchased on amazon, just for the record) and very disappointed with colors. They are nothing close to being realistic. I played with settings 2 days now and still cant get it right. If realistic colors is what you're looking for, don't purchase this one...

Reviews.Title: nice TV but...
Reviews.Author: Compdoc
Reviews.Content: This TV is very nice, and has a beautiful display. But I was very disappointed over a couple of things:1) It has a network jack, but no on-board apps. You cannot watch Amazon Prime, Netflix, or other on-line services using just this TV. You have to use a blu-ray player or some other device for this, if you have one. That was a shock for me. Why have the jack at all?2) As do all Samsung models of this type, it has impossible to see 'buttons' along the bottom of the screen used to turn it on/off and change channels. You can see them easily if you use a flashlight. That's just horrible ergonomics.Otherwise, if you don't mind that you're paying so much and not getting the features you would expect, I'm sure you will like this TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung - poor quality and support
Reviews.Author: Quinton Q "XILISTIK"
Reviews.Content: I own a Samsung LN46 LCD TV. I thought I was buying a quality brand. However, just after the one year point, the TV picture began to flutter. It has continued to get worse. Now, I am going to be stuck with a huge repair bill because Samsung is unwilling to admit that the problem is their fault. They are not willing to discuss the problem. Numerous emails on their site indicate that many other purchasers are experiencing the same problem. In addition. Another problem is their use of substandard capacitors has resulted in service calls for many owners. This problem is also acknowledged by them on the Samsung website. I have not had to repair a TV in 25 years. This is my first and last Samsung product. My advice to Samsung buyers is get extended insurance. You will need it.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Tarte
Reviews.Content: Not 5 stars as I was miss-led to believe this model had smart apps e.g. Pandora, Netflix, etc.  It does not.  Other than that the unit was easy to hook up and the picture is amazing.  Some color, etc. adjustments are needed, but very simple to do.  As other reviews have indicated, the eco mode is a joke, as it totally negates the picture quality.  As far as the internet goes, there are many "Samrt" Bluray players out there that have this functionality.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: After buying the TV, bringing it home, mounting it to the wall, I discovered that the audio worked but video did not. No picture, no on-screen menus, nothing. A call to Samsung customer service revealed that this is a common issue and was possibly due to damage in shipping (yeah, okay!) This is clearly a manufacturing defect that they know is out there sitting on shelves waiting for people like me to bring it home to discover.Their recommendation was to return it for a replacement or to have a service tech come to repair it. I'll be returning it for a replacement, but it wont be replaced with another Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Got it from Sears, but piece of crap broke!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: My gf and I spent several hours shopping, reviewing and searching for a tv after saving for up for one for months! We bought the LN46B630N1FUZA from Sears which is a version of this TV, and 3 years later we turn it on one day to find horizontal lines going up and down the screen randomly.Samsung told us to take it somewhere, where it was going to cost 60 bucks just to look at it, we decided to have someone come out and look at it. He said it was the main board, so we bought one for 120 bucks and after switching it, the problem persisted, so I bought a 60 dollar psu to replace the old on. Still no luck. After messing with it for hours and hours, doing tons of research on what the problem could be, the bottom left part of the screen cracked and the tv is now a useless pile of junk =(I refuse to purchase another samsung tv after this. I am a very unhappy customer and so is my gf.

Reviews.Title: Beware of Samsung Televisions
Reviews.Author: Radlax39
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung 46" TV in 2008 through Amazon Samsung LNT4665F 46" 1080p LCD HDTV.  Four-and-a-half years later, the TV started to have a problem whereby the LCD panel on one half of the screen would nearly completely dim after turning the TV on.  This problem lasts for around 30 minutes until the TV is warmed up.  This is a well-documented problem on the internet.  In fact there is a HighDefForum online whereby someone posted pictures of their own TV that could look almost exactly like mine.When I spoke to Samsung Executive Customer Service, I was informed that they would not pay for a tech rep to come to my house to repair the TV since the warranty was only for a year and would not extend the warranty for this issue.  This is a major problem because as the person in the forum noted, Samsung is no longer making the LCD panel for my TV that is likely the source of the problem.  In fact, customer service told me that even if the rep came out to repair the TV and determined that the LCD panel was the cause of the problem and confirmed that the panel was no longer available, I would still be responsible for the $60 diagnosis fee.This was the worst experience with customer service that I have ever had.  After this, I will never buy a Samsung product again.

Reviews.Title: Be careful - Samsung has capacitor problems
Reviews.Author: FairfaxMango
Reviews.Content: Good picture and ease of use, but Samsung LCDs have had numerous problems with capacitors after only a couple of years (Google it for more info), and the company will rarely stand behind its products after the warranty expires, even if it is a known manufacturing defect.  Our television worked for three years and then when it turned on, it would cycle on and off dozens of times, unable to power up and stay on.  The company took the position that it was outside the warranty and would not stand behind its product.  Unfortunate result, and drove us to Sony.

Reviews.Title: If you want a TV for only 18 months
Reviews.Author: Romedj
Reviews.Content: If you want a TV for only 18 months then this is the one to buy. However, if you want one that will last longer then stay away. Search the Internet and you will find many proplems with this TV and other Samsung TVs showing up right after warranty runs out. Some people will mention bad capacitors problems other will mention bad power supplies. I have yet solved mine, even after buying a new power supply board. Calling Samsung is no help at all. They know of the problems with their TVs but turn a blind eye after the warranty expires. So either get an extended warranty or stay away or maybe you will be one of the lucky ones. Do not buy this or any other Samsung LCD until they solve their quality issues!!!

Reviews.Title: Class action suit active for this set
Reviews.Author: J. Reidy
Reviews.Content: A friend just sent me a notice he received from Samsung concerning a lot of televisions manufactured before December, 2008. I have the 630 model, and we were thrilled with the picture. For about two years. We now have lines and shadows that appear after a cold startup, as you would do for the first time each day. Horizontal lines appear about 6" apart on this 40" model. There is also ghosting of the picture downward on the screen. Every so often on startup, the audio will start without a picture, requiring one or two restarts for the picture to appear.These are commonly reported issues, and I thought I was going to be on the hook until I received word of the class action settlement  that can be viewed at [...]. There are several options available if your set qualifies. I haven't contacted them yet, but the LN40A630 fits one of the qualified categories.In short,it was a great television, but in good conscience I can't recommend it. Televisions should, in my opinion, last more than three years.

Reviews.Title: Marina
Reviews.Author: Marina Sennet
Reviews.Content: Under NO CIRCUMSTANCES would I EVER Buy a Samsung TV again! I owned a 32 inch LCD that had the capacior problem. I called the customer service number and, after being disconnected no fewer than EIGHT times, was told by various customer service reps that 1) a service person would contact me for in home service (never happened) 2) I needed to ship the TV back to them UPS to have it repaired 3) they would issue me a $300 refund 4) no, they won't issue a refund 5) they have a service man available to fix it but not at a time I can arrange so.... basically they make a poor quality product and when their customer service doesn't disconnect you, they tell you conflicting and incorrect things. I'm putting the damned thing by the side of the road because it will cost me less to replace it than to take the time off work to have their "free" repair. NEVER AGAIN. Tell everyone you know.

Reviews.Title: This TV will last from 2-3 years!  SAMSUNG won't cover repairs
Reviews.Author: C.A.A.
Reviews.Content: I bought mine a little over two years ago and it recently broke.  Apparently it is a widespread issue where one day you go to turn it on and the TV goes on and then off, on/off, on/ff and continues this cycle sometimes never turning on until you unplug it for several second and try again.  Mine stopped turning on entirely.When I contacted SAMSUNG they basically told me "Tough Luck"!  So, I paid around a $1000 two years ago for this piece of junk.  That works out to be $38 month!!!!!  Ridiculous!HATE SAMSUNG CUSTOMER SERVICE AND WILL NEVER BUY AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: Bad service from Samsung - it WILL break
Reviews.Author: Dunder
Reviews.Content: We bought our Samsung 42" in 2008.  It died a few weeks ago and the internet is plastered with articles about Samsung capacitors dying on their TVs.  Samsung refuses to fix it unless I can produce a receipt.  I have the credit bill charge for $1100 and am the original owner but that isn't good enough. They won't fix it.  I won't buy a Samsung again.  I am going with LG or Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Beware the Samsung white screen
Reviews.Author: Felix
Reviews.Content: Bought a Samsung LCD TV 3 years ago and now the screen has gone all white.  This happens to a lot of people (just Google: Samsung white screen).  Called Samsung and they refuse to cover the repair cost, even though TV repair folks who've dealt with this problem say that it comes about because of a defect in manufacturing: one or more of the ICs isn't properly heat-shielded so it fries, causing the white screen.  It's such a common problem there's even a YouTube video describing how to fix it.If you're outside the one-year warranty, Samsung will not cover the repair costs.  Problem is, you can get the white screen after only a few days of use (read some of the online accounts), or after three years, like we did.So caveat emptor!  That was the first and last Samsung product I'll ever buy.

Reviews.Title: Packaging
Reviews.Author: RUhead2004
Reviews.Content: I'll tell you this much...I received this TV 2 days ago and the box was heavily damaged.  I unwrapped it and there was a HUGE dent on the TV itself on the upper right-hand side.  The styrofoam was broken along the top as well.  I contacted Amazon and they took it back no problem.  I would just be careful about buying an expensive product like this because UPS is unreliable.  The drivers could care less about handling your product gently.

Reviews.Title: Samsung stinks
Reviews.Author: Q
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 46 inch Samsung LCD HDTV about 2 1/2 years ago.  Within the last 2 months the picture has dark lines in it and most of the time half of the screen is black.  I called Samsung and they will do nothing without the extended warranty.  I purchased the Samsung when Consumer Reports gave it the highest rating in its category. I called a repairman and he is aware of the samsung LCD TVs  have the wrong capacitator in it and he said its more money to fix than to purchase a new one.  DO NOT PURCHASE A SAMSUNG!

Reviews.Author: Maria Lim
Reviews.Content: My brothers and sister ordered this TV for my dad as a Fathers' Day present. The TV was delivered on time and my dad was very happy to get the TV. But when he opened the box, the TV's LCD is broken and the TV does not work. We're totally annoyed about this since it just ruined our surprise for our dad.
